Column Comment.0: FINANCE SUIMMARY IDENTIFIER: Summary information about a financialreference, such as an AFE for an activity, such as seismic acquisition or processing.Could be a cost center or any other reference number.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: ACTUAL COST: the actual cost attributed to the AFE
Column Comment.3: AUTHORIZED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER; Unique identifier for thebusiness associate who authorized this AFE or cost center.
Column Comment.4: BUDGET COST: The funds originally allocated to the AFE.
Column Comment.5: CURRENCY CONVERSION: A number which, when multiplied by the stored value,will re-create the original value in the original currency used.
Column Comment.6: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure in which thecurrency was originally received.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the AFE or cost center number was effective.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the AFE expires
Column Comment.9: FINANCE TYPE: The type of financial information this is, such as AFE, Cost Center,Chart of Accounts reference etc.
Column Comment.10: REFERENCE FINANCE STATUS: the current status of the financial reference, suchas waiting for approval, closed out, active etc.
Column Comment.11: ISSUED DATE: the date that this AFE or cost center number was issued.
Column Comment.12: LIMIT AMOUNT: The maximum that can be charged to this cost center or AFE.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REFERENCE NUMBER: the number of the financial reference. Where naturalIdentifiers are used, may be the same as the ID. If surrogate ID is used, the actualnumber goes in this field.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.17: TAX CREDIT CODE: Code indicating the well qualifies for a tax credit. "C" = credit forthe well being permitted for coalbed methane gas.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
